greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The smallest prime whose square divides n, 1 if n is squarefree.
comment: A249740 gives the corresponding largest prime.
If n belongs to A013929, then a(n)>1. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 16 2016
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[If[SquareFreeQ@ n, 1, p = 2; While[! Divisible[n, p^2], p = NextPrime@ p]; p], {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 15 2016 *)
program: (Scheme) (define (A249739 n) (let loop ((n n) (p (A020639 n))) (cond ((= 1 n) n) ((zero? (modulo n (* p p))) p) (else (loop (/ n p) (A020639 (/ n p)))))))
(PARI) a(n) = {f = factor(n/core(n)); vsq = select(x->((x%2) == 0), f[,2], 1); if (#vsq, f[vsq[1], 1], 1);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 11 2017
xref: Differs from A071773 and A249740 for the first time at n=36, where a(36) = 2, while A249740(36) = 3 and A071773(36) = 6.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 04 2014
